author: Kate King
title: New Jersey Gov. Murphy to Dismiss Outside Law Firm in Atlantic City Takeover
text:
New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy said Monday the state would dismiss an outside overseer who has held wide-ranging powers over Atlantic City’s troubled finances and operations for more than a year.
Atlantic City, which teetered on the edge of bankruptcy two years ago, will remain under Trenton’s control, with the state Department of Community Affairs continuing to sign off on local decisions involving the city’s budget and government operations. But the state aims to end within 30 days the role of Jeffrey Chiesa, a private attorney...
